resources.string: My name is Jonathan Adler. I graduated from UW in 2003 with a degree in Zoology, and I have spent the last 13 years working in various labs. I have examined the stomach contents of juvenile salmon; fed chemicals to machines that build DNA microarrays; worked with drug companies to determine the bioavailability and metabolite profiles of experimental compounds; and prepared archaeological samples for radiocarbon dating by accelerator mass spectrometry.
